basics.name: Cael Yasutake
basics.label: Robotics MSE @ UPenn
basics.summary: I am a robotics master's student at the University of Pennsylvania, working at the intersection of robotics, AI, and high-performance computing. My work focuses on developing efficient, scalable algorithms for motion planning, control, and learning, with an emphasis on real-world robotic systems. I aim to advance robotic autonomy through algorithm design and systems-level optimization.

personalInfo.label: Stack
personalInfo.value: CUDA 路 PyTorch 路 ROS

personalInfo.label: Programming
personalInfo.value: C/C++ 路 Python 路 Matlab 路 Java

certificates.name: Machine Learning and Deep Learning Bootcamp in Python

work.name: A虏R Lab (Columbia University / Dartmouth College)
work.summary: Research on GPU-accelerated, sampling-based motion planning and inverse kinematics.
highlights: Designed a hybrid inverse kinematics algorithm combining orientation-aware coordinate descent with Jacobian polishing (arXiv:2510.07514).
Implemented custom CUDA kernels leveraging block/warp/thread parallelism for batched evaluation of thousands of problems with sub-mm / sub-degree levels of accuracy.

work.name: Columbia University
work.summary: Teaching assistant for AI course covering search, adversarial methods, probabilistic modeling, and ML.
highlights: Hosted 300+ hours of weekly office hours supporting course concepts and programming assignments.
Led recitations reinforcing key AI topics for 400+ students.

work.name: Columbia University & IBM Research Collaboration
work.summary: Analog In-Memory Computing (AIMC) optimization and adaptive partitioning for model accuracy/latency.
highlights: Co-developed optimization strategies to reduce computational load in AIMC cores and DPUs under IBM mentorship.
Prototyped an adaptive partitioning algorithm in PyTorch to improve accuracy and latency on COCO.

work.name: General Dynamics Information Technology (GDIT)
work.summary: Automation platforms and LLM data pipelines.
highlights: Co-developed automation platforms for asset tracking and management, improving visibility and reducing manual labor.
Curated and preprocessed datasets for LLM fine-tuning using Python automation and Hugging Face.

work.name: General Dynamics Information Technology (GDIT)
work.summary: Time-series modeling and data pipelines for forecasting.
highlights: Built prototype frameworks for multivariate time-series analysis improving accuracy over prior single-variate models.
Cleaned and transformed messy customer datasets using Pandas/NumPy for predictive modeling.

projects.name: HJCD-IK: Hybrid Jacobian and Coordinate Descent Inverse Kinematics
projects.description: GPU-Accelerated Inverse Kinematics through Batched Hybrid Jacobian Coordinate Descent.
highlights: Open-source inverse kinematics library designed for fast real-time motion planning.
Custom CUDA kernels for batched evaluation at scale.

projects.name: ShiBot-Inu: Learned Quadruped Locomotion
projects.description: Reinforcement learning for walking gaits on a custom quadruped robot in simulation.
highlights: Trained a custom-designed quadruped using reinforcement learning in NVIDIA Isaac Sim / Isaac Lab.

projects.name: Mobile Robot Navigation
projects.description: ROS 2 mobile robot navigation stack in simulation with Gazebo, LiDAR-based SLAM, online localization, costmap generation, and teleoperation.
highlights: Implemented SLAM using ROS to continuously estimate the robot's pose while incrementally building an occupancy grid mpa of the environment.

projects.name: Capture The Flag (Multi-Agent RL)
projects.description: Multi-agent RL environment optimizing gameplay strategies for capture the flag.
highlights: Designed a multi-agent RL environment and training setup.
